qas.question: Who wrote the book 'Memoirs of a Geisha' is based on?
Who did Spielberg collaborate with in 2006?
What film did Spielberg first collaborate with Zemeckis on?

answers.text: Back to the Future Part III

qas.question: In what year did the book Memoirs of a Geisha get released?
Who directed Back to the Future?
In what year did Brian Goldner join Hasbro?

context: Spielberg served as an uncredited executive producer on The Haunting, The Prince of Egypt, Just Like Heaven, Shrek, Road to Perdition, and Evolution. He served as an executive producer for the <a0_0><b5_0><b7_0>1997<b7_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> film Men in Black, and its sequels, Men in Black II and Men in Black III. In 2005, he served as a producer of Memoirs of a Geisha, an adaptation of the novel by <a1_0>Arthur Golden<a1_0/>, a film to which he was previously attached as director. In 2006, Spielberg co-executive produced with famed filmmaker <a2_0><b6_0>Robert Zemeckis<b6_0/><a2_0/> a CGI children's film called Monster House, marking their eighth collaboration since 1990's <a3_0>Back to the Future Part III<a3_0/>. He also teamed with Clint Eastwood for the first time in their careers, co-producing Eastwood's Flags of Our Fathers and Letters from Iwo Jima with Robert Lorenz and Eastwood himself. He earned his twelfth Academy Award nomination for the latter film as it was nominated for Best Picture. Spielberg served as executive producer for Disturbia and the Transformers live action film with Brian Goldner, an employee of Hasbro. The film was directed by Michael Bay and written by <b8_0>Roberto Orci<b8_0/> and <b9_0>Alex Kurtzman<b9_0/>, and Spielberg continued to collaborate on the sequels, Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen and Transformers: Dark of the Moon. In 2011, he produced the J. J. Abrams science fiction thriller film Super 8 for <a4_0>Paramount Pictures<a4_0/>.
